channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2024010362
item.description:
Report X-2024010362

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package found wet and leaking upon inspection the lids on the bottles had come loose causing and internal leak there was no packing to protect product DescribePack: lids on top of bottle came loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: i placed package in hazmat bag then placed in yellow drum for processing

item.title: Report X-2024010346
item.description:
Report X-2024010346

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-27
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024010346 SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded during the morning shift and notified personnel about the leaking package. Package was placed in a hazardous tote and bag for further inspection. DescribePack: Caps seals were off the bottles. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazardous tote and bag and placed under the vent in the hazmat cage. 2. X-2024010347 SequenceEvent: Package was leaking during the unloading process the was placed inside a hazardous tote and bag for further inspection. DescribePack: The cap seals caused an internal leak. Small holes in the seals. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazardous tote and bag and taken to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024010340
item.description:
Report X-2024010340

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-27
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was placed on rollers when it fell over, one of the lids became loose due to no inner packing at all to protect the contents inside. DescribePack: Due to a cap becoming loose the outside of the box and the inside became stained and wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed into a yellow drum lined with a hazmat bag to prevent any further leaking.

item.title: Report X-2024010355
item.description:
Report X-2024010355

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was going to be loaded when it was dropped due to another package. No inner packing caused the lids to easily become loose. DescribePack: The lack of inner packing caused the lids to become loose causing leakage and a tear on the side of the box as well as becoming wet due to the contents inside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was then picked up and placed in a red tote lined with a hazmat bag to prevent further leaking.

  • Description: RESPONDER RECIEVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE UNLOAD WALL. UPON ARRIVAL IDENTIFIED SAID LEAKING PACKAGE. PLACED LEAKING PACKAGE IN SPILL TRAY AND CLEANED UP SPILL. TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DMP ARE FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024010059
item.description:
Report X-2024010059

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-10T15:11:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS DRIVING TO OTHER LEAKER IN FULL PPE WHEN CALLED OVER TO THIS LEAKER BY RMP SUPERVISOR, IN FULL PPE. THE RMP PLACED THE LEAKER ONTO SPILL CART. RESPONDER THEN CONTINUED TO HIS NEXT LEAKER CALL BEFORE BRINGING BOTH BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024010325
item.description:
Report X-2024010325

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-12T18:13:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to the damage area for further inspection by a trained personnel. Upon inspection the cap lock for the container failed during the unloading process. Approximately, 5 cups of the liquid leaked out which caused the package to be soiled. DescribePack: The cap lock failed. DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: The package was further inspected by a trained personnel to reduce any possible injuries.
